subject: Relationships
title: Emotional Abuse: The Invisible Wound
description: A short lesson to help you apply Emotional Abuse: The Invisible Wound.

hook.text: He never hit her. But every day he made her feel stupid, worthless, and lucky he stayed. The wounds are invisible.

buildup.text: Emotional abuse includes belittling, constant criticism, isolation, threats, and withholding affection.

discovery.text: Research shows emotional abuse causes the same brain damage patterns as physical abuse â€” sometimes worse.

twist.text: Victims often don't recognize it. 'He never hit me' becomes the reason they stay, even as their self-worth dissolves.

climax.text: Abuse doesn't require a bruise. Words repeated daily can shatter a person as thoroughly as any fist.

punchline.text: Emotional abuse leaves no bruises â€” just someone who can't recognize themselves.

quiz.question: How does emotional abuse compare to physical abuse in brain impact?
options: Causes the same or worse brain damage patterns
